metadata.description: Input the name of your OMS Workspace
The name of the action group for alert actions

search.name: cf.auctioneer.AuctioneerLRPAuctionsFailed.critical
search.query: CF_CounterEvent_CL | where Origin_s == "auctioneer" and Name_s == "AuctioneerLRPAuctionsFailed" | summarize sum(Delta_d) by Environment_s, bin(EventTime_t, 1m) | summarize avg(sum_Delta_d) by Environment_s | where avg_sum_Delta_d >= 1

alert.description: The number of Long Running Process (LRP) instances that the auctioneer failed to place on Diego cells. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#AuctioneerLRPAuctionsFailed

search.name: cf.auctioneer.AuctioneerLRPAuctionsFailed.warning
search.query: CF_CounterEvent_CL | where Origin_s == "auctioneer" and Name_s == "AuctioneerLRPAuctionsFailed" | summarize sum(Delta_d) by Environment_s, bin(EventTime_t, 1m) | summarize avg(sum_Delta_d) by Environment_s | where avg_sum_Delta_d >= 0.5

alert.description: The number of Long Running Process (LRP) instances that the auctioneer failed to place on Diego cells. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#AuctioneerLRPAuctionsFailed

search.name: cf.auctioneer.AuctioneerFetchStatesDuration.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "auctioneer" and Name_s == "AuctioneerFetchStatesDuration" | where Value_d >= 5000000000

alert.displayName: CF-Auctioneer Time to Fetch Cell State
alert.description: Time in ns that the auctioneer took to fetch state from all the Diego cells when running its auction. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#AuctioneerFetchStatesDuration

search.name: cf.auctioneer.AuctioneerFetchStatesDuration.warning
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "auctioneer" and Name_s == "AuctioneerFetchStatesDuration" | where Value_d >= 2000000000

alert.displayName: CF-Auctioneer Time to Fetch Cell State
alert.description: Time in ns that the auctioneer took to fetch state from all the Diego cells when running its auction. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#AuctioneerFetchStatesDuration

search.name: cf.auctioneer.AuctioneerLRPAuctionsStarted.critical
search.query: CF_CounterEvent_CL | where Origin_s == "auctioneer" and Name_s == "AuctioneerLRPAuctionsStarted" | summarize sum(Delta_d) by Environment_s, bin(EventTime_t, 1m) | summarize avg(sum_Delta_d) by Environment_s | where avg_sum_Delta_d > 20

alert.description: The number of LRP instances that the auctioneer successfully placed on Diego cells. <NOTICE>This alert should have threshold settings based on scale and usage of your own CF deployment, please tuning its threshold in OMS settings if the default value is not suitable.</NOTICE> For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#AuctioneerLRPAuctionsStarted

search.name: cf.auctioneer.AuctioneerLRPAuctionsStarted.warning
search.query: CF_CounterEvent_CL | where Origin_s == "auctioneer" and Name_s == "AuctioneerLRPAuctionsStarted" | summarize sum(Delta_d) by Environment_s, bin(EventTime_t, 1m) | summarize avg(sum_Delta_d) by Environment_s | where avg_sum_Delta_d > 10

alert.description: The number of LRP instances that the auctioneer successfully placed on Diego cells. <NOTICE>This alert should have threshold settings based on scale and usage of your own CF deployment, please tuning its threshold in OMS settings if the default value is not suitable.</NOTICE> For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#AuctioneerLRPAuctionsStarted

search.name: cf.auctioneer.AuctioneerTaskAuctionsFailed.critical
search.query: CF_CounterEvent_CL | where Origin_s == "auctioneer" and Name_s == "AuctioneerTaskAuctionsFailed" | summarize sum(Delta_d) by Environment_s, bin(EventTime_t, 1m) | summarize avg(sum_Delta_d) by Environment_s | where avg_sum_Delta_d >= 1

alert.description: The number of Tasks that the auctioneer failed to place on Diego cells. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#AuctioneerTaskAuctionsFailed

search.name: cf.auctioneer.AuctioneerTaskAuctionsFailed.warning
search.query: CF_CounterEvent_CL | where Origin_s == "auctioneer" and Name_s == "AuctioneerTaskAuctionsFailed" | summarize sum(Delta_d) by Environment_s, bin(EventTime_t, 1m) | summarize avg(sum_Delta_d) by Environment_s | where avg_sum_Delta_d >= 0.5

alert.description: The number of Tasks that the auctioneer failed to place on Diego cells. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#AuctioneerTaskAuctionsFailed

search.name: cf.bbs.ConvergenceLRPDuration.warning
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "bbs" and Name_s == "ConvergenceLRPDuration" | where Value_d >= 10000000000

search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "bbs" and Name_s == "RequestLatency" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s | where avg_Value_d >= 10000000000

alert.description: Time in ns that the BBS took to handle requests, aggregated across all its API endpoints. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#RequestLatency

search.name: cf.bbs.RequestLatency.warning
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "bbs" and Name_s == "RequestLatency" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s | where avg_Value_d >= 5000000000

alert.description: Time in ns that the BBS took to handle requests, aggregated across all its API endpoints. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#RequestLatency

search.name: cf.bbs.Domain.cf-apps.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "bbs" and Name_s == "Domain.cf-apps" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s | where avg_Value_d < 1

alert.displayName: CF-Cloud Controller and Diego in Sync
alert.description: Indicates if the cf-apps Domain is up-to-date, meaning that CF App requests from Cloud Controller are synchronized to bbs.LRPsDesired (Diego-desired AIs) for execution. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#cc-diego-sync

search.name: cf.bbs.LRPsExtra.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "bbs" and Name_s == "LRPsExtra" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s | where avg_Value_d >= 10

alert.description: Total number of LRP instances that are no longer desired but still have a BBS record. When Diego wants to add more apps, the BBS sends a request to the auctioneer to spin up additional LRPs. LRPsExtra is the total number of LRP instances that are no longer desired but still have a BBS record. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#LRPsExtra

search.name: cf.bbs.LRPsExtra.warning
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "bbs" and Name_s == "LRPsExtra" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s | where avg_Value_d >= 5

alert.description: Total number of LRP instances that are no longer desired but still have a BBS record. When Diego wants to add more apps, the BBS sends a request to the auctioneer to spin up additional LRPs. LRPsExtra is the total number of LRP instances that are no longer desired but still have a BBS record. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#LRPsExtra

search.name: cf.bbs.LRPsMissing.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "bbs" and Name_s == "LRPsMissing" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s | where avg_Value_d >= 10

alert.description: Total number of LRP instances that are desired but have no record in the BBS. When Diego wants to add more apps, the BBS sends a request to the auctioneer to spin up additional LRPs. LRPsMissing is the total number of LRP instances that are desired but have no BBS record. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#LRPsMissing

search.name: cf.bbs.LRPsMissing.warning
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "bbs" and Name_s == "LRPsMissing" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s | where avg_Value_d >= 5

alert.description: Total number of LRP instances that are desired but have no record in the BBS. When Diego wants to add more apps, the BBS sends a request to the auctioneer to spin up additional LRPs. LRPsMissing is the total number of LRP instances that are desired but have no BBS record. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#LRPsMissing

search.name: cf.rep.RepBulkSyncDuration.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "rep" and Name_s == "RepBulkSyncDuration" and Value_d >= 10000000000

alert.description: Time in ns that the Diego Cell Rep took to sync the ActualLRPs that it claimed with its actual garden containers. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#RepBulkSyncDuration

search.name: cf.rep.RepBulkSyncDuration.warning
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "rep" and Name_s == "RepBulkSyncDuration" and Value_d >= 5000000000

search.name: cf.rep.UnhealthyCell.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "rep" and Name_s == "UnhealthyCell" and Value_d != 0 | summarize count() by Environment_s

alert.description: The Diego cell periodically checks its health against the garden backend. For Diego cells, 0 means healthy, and 1 means unhealthy. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#UnhealthyCell

search.name: cf.locket.ActiveLocks.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "locket" and Name_s == "ActiveLocks" | summarize max(Value_d) by Environment_s | where max_Value_d != 4

alert.description: Total count of how many locks the system components are holding. As of PCF v1.11, the BBS, Auctioneer, TPS Watcher, and Routing API components have migrated to Locket from Consul lock. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#ActiveLocks

search.name: cf.locket.ActivePresences.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "locket" and Name_s == "ActivePresences" | where Value_d > 25

alert.description: Total count of active presences. Presences are defined as the registration records that the cells maintain to advertise themselves to the platform. <NOTICE>This alert should have threshold settings based on scale and usage of your own CF deployment, please tuning its threshold in OMS settings if the default value is not suitable.</NOTICE> For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#ActivePresences

search.name: cf.locket.ActivePresences.warning
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "locket" and Name_s == "ActivePresences" | where Value_d > 10

alert.description: Total count of active presences. Presences are defined as the registration records that the cells maintain to advertise themselves to the platform. <NOTICE>This alert should have threshold settings based on scale and usage of your own CF deployment, please tuning its threshold in OMS settings if the default value is not suitable.</NOTICE> For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#ActivePresences

alert.description: Time in ns that the active route-emitter took to perform its synchronization pass. <NOTICE>This alert should have threshold settings based on scale and usage of your own CF deployment, please tuning its threshold in OMS settings if the default value is not suitable.</NOTICE> For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#RouteEmitterSyncDuration

search.name: cf.route_emitter.RouteEmitterSyncDuration.warning

search.name: cf.mysql.availability.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "mysql" and Name_s == "/mysql/available" and Value_d < 1

alert.description: The MySQL Server is currently responding to requests, which indicates that the server is running. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#-mysql-server-availability

search.name: cf.mysql.galera.wsrep_ready.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "mysql" and Name_s == "/mysql/galera/wsrep_ready" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s, SourceInstance_s | where avg_Value_d == 0

alert.description: Shows whether each cluster node can accept queries. Returns only 0 or 1. When this metric is 0, almost all queries to that node fail with the error:ERROR 1047 (08501) Unknown Command. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#-galera-cluster-node-readiness

search.name: cf.mysql.galera.wsrep_ready.warning
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "mysql" and Name_s == "/mysql/galera/wsrep_ready" | summarize avg(Value_d) by Environment_s, SourceInstance_s | where avg_Value_d < 1

alert.description: Shows whether each cluster node can accept queries. Returns only 0 or 1. When this metric is 0, almost all queries to that node fail with the error:ERROR 1047 (08501) Unknown Command. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#-galera-cluster-node-readiness

alerts._comment: Not exactly the same as instruction, as instructed (Average of the values of each node / cluster size) should always be 1

search.name: cf.mysql.galera.wsrep_cluster_size.critical

alert.description: The number of cluster nodes with which each node is communicating normally. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#-galera-cluster-size

alerts._comment: Not exactly the same as instruction, as instructed (Average of the values of each node / cluster size) should always be 1

search.name: cf.mysql.galera.wsrep_cluster_status.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "mysql" and Name_s == "/mysql/galera/wsrep_cluster_status" | summarize argmax(EventTime_t, Value_d) by Environment_s, SourceInstance_s | summarize sum(max_EventTime_t_Value_d) by Environment_s | where sum_max_EventTime_t_Value_d < 1

alert.description: Shows the primary status of the cluster component that the node is in. Values are 1 for Primary, 0 for Non-primary, -1 for Disconnected. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#-galera-cluster-status

alert.description: Shows the primary status of the cluster component that the node is in. Values are 1 for Primary, 0 for Non-primary, -1 for Disconnected. For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#-galera-cluster-status

search.name: cf.gorouter.total_requests.critical
search.query: CF_CounterEvent_CL | where Origin_s == "gorouter" and Name_s == "total_requests" | summarize sum(Delta_d) by SourceInstance_s | where sum_Delta_d > 100000

alert.description: The lifetime number of requests completed by the GoRouter VM. <NOTICE>This alert should have threshold settings based on scale and usage of your own CF deployment, please tuning its threshold in OMS settings if the default value is not suitable.</NOTICE> For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#total_requests

search.name: cf.gorouter.total_requests.warning
search.query: CF_CounterEvent_CL | where Origin_s == "gorouter" and Name_s == "total_requests" | summarize sum(Delta_d) by SourceInstance_s | where sum_Delta_d > 50000

alert.description: The lifetime number of requests completed by the GoRouter VM. <NOTICE>This alert should have threshold settings based on scale and usage of your own CF deployment, please tuning its threshold in OMS settings if the default value is not suitable.</NOTICE> For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#total_requests

search.name: cf.gorouter.latency.critical
search.query: CF_ValueMetric_CL | where Origin_s == "gorouter" and Name_s == "latency" | summarize avg(Value_d) by SourceInstance_s | where avg_Value_d > 5000

alert.description: The time in milliseconds that the GoRouter takes to handle requests to its app endpoints. This is the average round trip response time to an app, which includes router handling. <NOTICE>This alert should have threshold settings based on scale and usage of your own CF deployment, please tuning its threshold in OMS settings if the default value is not suitable.</NOTICE> For details, please check https://docs.pivotal.io/pivotalcf/1-12/monitoring/kpi.html#latency
